snippet: Restoring a sense of justice will not be easy in a St. Louis suburb, but angry protesters should be able to vent peacefully, as is their constitutional right.
abstract: Editorial welcomes fact that Missouri Gov Jay Nixon has put State Highway Patrol in charge of policing protests in Ferguson; condemns overly aggressive police response to protests surrounding shooting death of unarmed teenager Michael Brown; contends Nixon and Pres Obama have obligation to ensure that real dialogue begins in Ferguson and other racially segregated areas.
lead_paragraph: Restoring a sense of justice will not be easy in a St. Louis suburb, but angry protesters should be able to vent peacefully, as is their constitutional right.

headline.seo: Abusive Police Tactics in Ferguson Will Only Delay Justice
headline.main: The Search for Calm in Missouri
headline.print_headline: The Search for Calm in Missouri
